articles.description: For four days, Ramos looked through roughly 250 corpses in search of his dad, both inside the morgue and in shipping containers that had been set up outside to handle the overflow.
articles.content:
(CNN)When Flavio Ramos was wheeled into the hospital room, he was gasping for air and slipping in and out of consciousness. So it was his son, Arturo, who first noticed the bodies. 
Two corpses laid unattended on the tile floor. By the next morning, the body… [+9718 chars]

articles.description: There are lots of questions about what can be done so gyms can reopen safely during the coronavirus pandemic. Here, experts explain measures to take.

In March, gyms and fitness studios closed due to the coronavirus. But now some states are looking to relax guidelines, which raises the question: How can gyms reopen safely?

articles.title: Tasmania has again recorded no new cases of coronavirus - The Mercury
articles.description: FOR a third day in a row Tasmania has recorded no new cases of coronavirus.
articles.content:
FOR a third day in a row Tasmania has recorded no new cases of coronavirus.
In an update on Sunday night, Public Health director Mark Veitch said the number of cases detected in the state remained at 225.

articles.author: CNN
articles.title: Study shows COVID-19 patients who took heartburn drug were less likely to die, but researchers caution more research is needed - 9News
articles.description: Patients who took a common heartburn medicine while hospitalised for COVID-19 were more than twice as likely to survive the infection, according to a paper posted Friday on a pre-publication website.
